page.title: 02KIRTON HORTICULTURE STATION
page.content: Is ideally situated to serve growers of vegetables, flower bulbs and strawberries. It comprises 40ha of land, 24 of which are silty loam to silty clay loam and 16 of excellent medium fine-textured sandy loam. Run by M.A.F.F. the{vegetable}work includes testing new varieties and investigating many aspects of crop production. There is interest in the uniformity and continuity of supply of high quality produce suitable for home and overseas markets. Work on the uniform establishment of seedlings in a range of modules now leads the world and is applied commercially by at least 50% of brassica growers. Also in the forefront is work on better harvesting, ice-bank cooling and computer controlled stores.
